Run RLSeq

Source: R/RLSeq.R
RLSeq.Rd

Runs the full RLSeq pipeline.

RLSeq(object, quiet = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

object

An RLRanges object.
quiet

If TRUE, messages are suppressed. Default: FALSE.
...

Arguments passed to analyzeRLFS. See analyzeRLFS.

Value

An RLRanges object with all results available.

Details

The RLSeq() function does all of the following:

  1. RLFS Perm Test. Runs the analyzeRLFS() function to test the enrichment of user-supplied ranges within R-loop-forming sequences.

  2. Predict Condition. Runs the predictCondition() function to predict whether the user-supplied sample robustly maps R-loops or not.

  3. Feature enrichment test. Runs the featureEnrich() function to test the enrichment of user-supplied ranges within R-loop-relevant genomic features.

  4. Correlation Analysis. Runs the corrAnalyze() function to test the correlation of user-supplied R-loop signal with other samples in RLBase around "gold-standard" R-loop regions.

  5. Gene annotation. Runs the geneAnnotation() function to find the overlap of genes with the user-supplied ranges.

  6. R-loop Region Analysis. Runs the rlRegionTest() function to find the overlap of user-supplied ranges with consensus R-loop sites (RL-Regions).

Examples

# Example RLRanges
rlr <- readRDS(system.file("ext-data", "rlrsmall.rds", package = "RLSeq"))

# Run RLSeq
# `useMask=FALSE` & `ntime=10` for demonstration purposes only.
# For an accurate analysis, use `rlr <- RLSeq(rlr)`
rlr <- RLSeq(rlr, useMask = FALSE, ntimes = 10)
